summary:
The Crimean War was fought between Russia and an alliance of the Ottoman Empire, France, the UK, and Sardinia-Piedmont. The main cause was a dispute over Christian rights in Ottoman-ruled Palestine. Russia wanted power over Eastern Orthodox Christians, while France supported Roman Catholics.

After Russia refused to back down, the Ottomans declared war. The allies landed in Crimea, attacked Sevastopol, and won key battles. Russia, facing defeat and isolation, sued for peace. The Treaty of Paris ended the war, weakening Russia and leading to reforms. It was one of the first wars with modern technology and extensive photography.
title: Crimean War
